column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The day we were there they had a very big Magritte ("this is not a pipe") exhibit. The number of pieces and supporting documents were impressive
column2: but even more so was the environment in which the pieces were shown. It was very dark
column3: and in one section they had one work displayed on successive walls that you sort of snaked your way through. I'm not describing it well
column4: but it really was a wonderful way to experience the pieces.
